review_title: It’s a great place to work

job_title: Mental Health Assistant in Canton, MA

review_title: Great if you need to need make decent money without any experience
job_title: Mental Health Assistant in Canton, MA
pros: I've worked here for a little over a year now and it pays $16/hr with unlimited overtime if you are full time.  Overtime puts you at around $21/hr. You can get paid to sleep (unless a crisis happens, then you have to wake up) for 12/hr. Great Benefits, 401k opportunities.  You could get the chance to also have your higher education paid for if you sign a contract with the company for 2 years with a promotion. CPR and Safety care certification + more within the first 3 week training period ($12/hr).
cons: The work is TERRIBLE.  You work with clients who are very difficult to deal with and that many other mental health programs are unable to deal with. That's why they get sent here. Get ready to restrain kids, be attacked at times, potentially get spit on, etc. AND you will be monitored pretty much at all times via cameras and microphones. It's a very different work environment but it is somewhat rewarding.

job_title: Shift Supervisor in Providence, RI
pros: Benefits are decent. Challenging working environment. Cameras and audio is a plus, though some may feel otherwise.  If something happens, the cameras and audio are your friends.  Must know policies and procedures like back of hand. Was fun working there though it can be stressful at times. It is one of the best places to learn behavior therapy because the students are difficult cases with high dangerous/health behaviors and training is extensive and ongoing.
cons: Working environment is very competitive, which can be negative depending on how you handle yourself and evaluations.  If you do your job and well, it can pay off.

job_title: Mental Health Assistant in Canton, MA
pros: Great Pay, a lot of overtime available, rewarding work
cons: Working with clients can be very dangerous as many of them are aggressive and self-destructive. Higher ups don't listen to front line staff, a lot of them are judgmental and take clients' word over staffs'.  I would only recommend this job if someone I know really needs a job. The atmosphere isn't consistently a "team" atmosphere. Too many chiefs. The last 2 years I was there, the quality of newer staff dropped drastically and a lot more experienced staff were getting injured as a result.

job_title: Software in Canton, MA
pros:
A very challenge place to work, you will use your knowledge of your field in ways you never thought you would because of the client population they have as well as the staff that work there.
9 to 5 work place
cons: The upper C level management run the company like an "Old Boy Network" if you are not in that group you will  go no where. Raises are never the same nor even yearly they just come. no formal review process. micro managed from the top down but no one is truly willing to take responsibility for when their decisions go wrong, they blame the employee who carried it out.

job_title: Investigative Journalust in Canton, MA
pros: There are absolutely no positive reasons to work there unless you are only in it for the money and benefits.
cons: I offered Executive Director Crookes an Applied Behavior Analysis Social Validity Measurement to determine the level of client satisfaction with JRC Applied Behavior Analysis extremely painful electric skin shock behavior rate decelerator devices, Basically, she said it would not be a good idea since I did not stop quoting the United Nations Special Rapporteur on Torture Mendez who concluded JRC skin shock coupled with immobolizing restraint on a board was "torture."

review_title: A popularity contest amongst staff and supervisors
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Providence, RI
pros:
I enjoyed working with the clients. Especially the adolescence program.

Seeing some success stories happen from a students initial placement to graduation.

Pay was decent.

Benefits are good.

Overtime available
cons:
Stressful and exhausting at times 

VERY clique! Extreme favoritism. If you were:
-not part of the "cool crew"
-not known by a shift supervisor 
-a new staff
your shift(s) can be very miserable and long experiences, ESPECIALLY if there was a crisis during your shift. 

Behavioral modification is physically and mentally draining.

Many seasoned staff felt the need to  throw around their power to newer staff resulting in belittling new staff.

job_title: Mental Heath Assistant in Canton, MA
pros: Money is ok.  Many shift options.  Many of the clients are endearing.
cons: Tends to be a stressful environment since cameras are on you at all times and there are incentives for writing coworkers up for minor infractions.  Many of the clients tend to be aggressive and you have to be on guard every moment to avoid injury to yourself and clients.  Constant notation of paperwork of client behavior.  On your feet basically the entire shift. Sometimes hard to get relieved of duty at the end of shift.

review_title: Great job to transition into other careers. Great job for students
